comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Drawing a blank on this pretty young woman. Trying some spelling variants, my only possible clue is in The evening world., July 14, 1922, Wall Street Final Edition, Page 9, top of col 2. chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030193/1922-07-14/ed-... under the headline, THREE CHILDREN NEARLY KILLED BY GLASS PUT IN FOOD "The boys are Benny Edgerton, seven: Reed Wolfert, five, and Gregory Kelnlnger, one, grandsons of Mrs. Charles M. Edgerton, Brlggs and Hawtree Avenues. Benny Is the son of D. M, Edgerton. Reed Is the son of F. W. Wolfert and grandson of former State Senator Wolfert of Brooklyn. Gregory Is the baby son of Mr. and Mrs. F. Kienlnger." No mention of Reed's mother, but presumably she was an Edgerton. Following that path, I found boards.ancestry.com/localities.northam.usa.states.newyork... which says "I understand from my father that my Florence edgerton's father was a Charles M. Edgerton. My florence married Frederick Wolfert, however, my father fredericks son was brought up by his grandmother harriet. Florence seems to have disappeared from the family ..." So this could be the former Florence Edgerton -- but I wouldn't bet on it.
